dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CU TV SCREEN: News reports of the attemped NYC bombing.

dialogues.speaker: REPORTER, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: It is in surveillance video and pictures like this of the explosive- laden vehicle just moments before it was parked, that police hope to find the man who wanted so badly last night to leave a body count in Times Square.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The TV news report continues playing in the bg. Bradley is moving as fast down a hallway. Coming towards him like a shark from the other end of the hallway: Maya. Bradley looks determined not to deal with her right now, lowers his head, but she spreads her arms slightly and basically blocks his passage through the hallway

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I really need to talk to you about beefing up our surveillance operation on the caller.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We don't have a surveillance operation on the caller. (turning to Maya) Someone just tried to blow up Times Square and you're talking to me about some facilitator who some detainee seven years ago said might have been working with Al Qaeda? Maya is practically shaking with zealous rage at her inab to bend Bradley to her will.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's the key to bin Laden.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't fucking care about bin Laden. I care about the next attack. You're going to start working on American Al Qaeda cells. Protect the homeland.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: bin Laden is the one who keeps telling them to attack the homeland.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If it wasn't for him, Al Qaeda would still be focused on overseas targets. If you really want to protect the homeland, you need to get bin Laden.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This guy never met bin Laden. This guy is a free lancer working off the fucking internet. No one has even talked to bin Laden in four years: he's out of the game, he may well even be dead but you know what you're doing? You're chasing a ghost while the whole fucking network grows all around you! For a moment she is silenced by Bradley's reprimand but t Maya's obsession speaks for her - and like a woman posses she recklessly goes at him:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You just want me to nail some low level Mullah-crack-a-dulla so that you can check that box on your resume that says while you were in Pakistan you got a real terrorist. But the truth is you don't understand Pakistan, and you don't know Al Qaeda. Either give me the team I need to follow this lead, or the other thing you're gonna have on your resume is being the first Station Chief to be called before a congressional committee for subverting the efforts to capture or kill bin Laden.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're fucking out of your mind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need four techs in a safe house in Rawalpindi and four techs in a safe house in Peshawar. Either send them out or send me back to DC and explain to the Director why you did it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maya, despondent, sits at the bar, drinking a beer.
Jack approaches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck the mom, we got the man himself. Jack puts a cell phone down on the counter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yesterday your caller bought himself a cell phone. And every time his phone rings - (he taps the cell

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - This phone will ring. Did I hook you up? Maya throws her arms around him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Larry drives his team around the narrow streets of Rawalp In the backseat, the COMPUTER TECH studies his laptop-lik tracking device. MAYA O.S. My guess is that he lives close to where he's making the calls, and it makes sense he'd be living in Rawalpindi because there's an Al Jezerra office there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We focus on a MAP of Pakistan on the wall. Maya is indica neighborhoods in Rawalpindi. She's briefing Bradley, Haki Larry and a few other people.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It would be convenient for him to drop tapes off if he's sending either from bin Laden or from an intermediary. When he wants to make a call, he leaves the house, walks a few blocks, then switches on the phone. We need to keep canvassing the neighborhood until we find him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Larry is at the wheel, moving slowly through a dangerous part of town. The streets narrow. Two motorcycles suddenly pull around in front of Larry's and stop. The riders pull out guns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We got a shooter! Larry tries reversing but a compact car wheels in right b them, and Larry slams on the brakes. The TECH raises an M

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're blocked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me talk to them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hakim gets out of the car and walks toward the men. We ca hear what they're saying. At last, Hakim comes back to th car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They said white faces don't belong here. If they don't move, shoot them. A tense beat while the men stare, then finally leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On a large wall map, Maya circles "Peshawar" in red.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Larry's SUV speeds onto a highway, weaving in and out of dense traffic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the backseat, the Computer Tech is getting tossed arou trying to hang onto the Geo Locating device in his lap. T Geo Locator starts to BEEP - a blinking red light.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's east of us. Try the market.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The congestion thickens. They slow to a crawl. The SUV, stuck in traffic. Can't move. Larry leaps out of the car and heads into an open air mar

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's packed. All MEN - most with traditional beards worn Al Qaeda members - many talking on cell phones. Impossible to tell who is who. Impossible to find this ne in a haystack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The search continues... Hakim prowls a back alley. Then goes up on a rooftop to survey the activity below.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hakim is on a street corner conducting surveillance. We follow him into a crowd and then lose sight... We find him again, another street, another fruitless sear As Hakim goes from street to street, we hear: JACK O.S. We got a signal on Tipu Road for ten minutes. Then he went to Umar Road for five minutes. Nogaza Road. Darya Abad. That's in the Umar Road area. In Rawalpindi: Haider Road, Roomi Road. He went to the Convoy Road, which is near the hospital. So that's Haider, Roomi Road, Said, No Gaza, Taimur. He made a call from Haifa Street, that's the spice district.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack and Maya click through the tracking maps on her comp screen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lahore street, which is also in Pesh, thirty minutes. Wazir Bag Road, five. Nishterabad, five. Phandu Road, five minutes, the Grand Trunk Road, forty five seconds. There's no pattern. Sometimes he calls every two weeks - sometimes every three - there's no consistency - I can't predict when he's gonna make another call because the guy's erratic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you think its intentional?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It might be. Maybe it just looks erratic to us. I just can't tell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wearing a black burkha, Maya walks into her house and sin into the couch. She pulls off the head covering but doesn bother to remove the burkha. She switches on the TV. If you didn't know her better, you'd think she'd gone native

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Find Maya driving up to a check point mobbed with PROTEST carrying signs - Joseph Bradley IS A CIA SPY! KILL THE SP Bradley is CIA, etc.

dialogues.speaker: REPORTER, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Meanwhile, our chief foreign correspondent, Richard Engel, confirms the CIA's top spy in Pakistan has been pulled out of there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The PROTESTERS have blocked the embassy check point. It's going to take a long time to get through.

dialogues.speaker: REPORTER, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: He's been receiving death threats after being named publicly in a lawsuit by the family of a victim of a U.S. drone attack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Several protesters notice her - they move to her car and start banging on it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maya and Bradley and several other STAFFERS watch the pro through a window -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The CROWD grows larger and more unruly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ISI fucked you. I'm so sorry Joseph. It's the first time she's addressed him by his first name Startling, to hear kindness in her voice. Joseph turns to reply then thinks better of it and walks away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Larry's minivan chugs through the crowded markets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Still on tower three! Five. Signal getting stronger. Ten! Larry continues driving straight down the main road.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fifteen. Ten. Signal's getting weaker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We lost him - no signal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heading South. The van passes horse-drawn carts, men on cell phones, fru stands. The Tech studies his screen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's up at five again. Fifteen. Twenty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Weaker now, he's shifted. We're back to five. I don't get it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's driving in circles. Larry now drives very fast back to the main road.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No change?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And now Larry stops in the middle of the market.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's hope he comes back around. Beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Twenty. Thirty. Forty! Fifty - we're within ten meters of him. Larry scans the street - sees a half dozen guys on cell phones.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's really close.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look at the cars. He's in a vehicle. Larry spots something:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guy with the phone in the white SUV. They snap a photograph of a WHITE POTAHAR SUV.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Could be.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm breaking off - The grey minivan pulls away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Larry's photograph of the WHITE POTAHAR SUV plops on Maya desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is this what I think it is?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guy you've been looking for, geo- located on his cell phone in his white car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you're right, the whole world's gonna want in on this, so you gotta stick to your guns now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The new Chief of Station, TIM ALEXANDER, barely looks up from his desk as Maya enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm amazed that you're still here. (looks at his watch,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When can we grab lunch? He sees that Maya, who hovers annoyingly over his desk, i gonna wait.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need a picket line along the GT highway and men spaced at intervals along the road and at every exit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maya, I know -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you agree with me now. This is important?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I've just learned from my predecessor that life is better when I don't disagree with you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A two lane highway. Tucked on the side of the road is an OLD MAN with a cart of mangoes.

dialogues.speaker: MAYA, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Our current hypothesis is that he lives somewhere along the highway, in one of the towns, or a medium sized city called Abbottabod, or up near Kashmir. ECU: mango cart. Nestled among the fruit is a BLACK RADIO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Squatting in the dirt near a bus stop is another OLD MAN, watching passengers disembark from a bus.

dialogues.speaker: MAYA, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Kashmir is interesting because it's a way station for the Tribals. We stay with the old man for a while. At last, the white POTAHAR SUV drives past. He makes a no in his pad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A nut seller, another CIA look out, scoops a handful of n into a bag for a CUSTOMER as he keeps an eye on CARS exit the highway. He takes note as the white POTAHAR passes him.

dialogues.speaker: MAYA, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Abbottabod is interesting because we know from detainee reporting that Faraj stayed there, briefly in 2003.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The street is filled with compact cars.

dialogues.speaker: MAYA, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: The good news is he's driving a white SUV. SUV's are actually pretty rare in Pakistan. If he was driving a sedan or a compact, we'd be fucked.

dialogues.speaker: MAYA, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Obviously this assumes he doesn't change vehicles. Maya at her desk working and we realize that she has been typing all this in a cable she will email to Washington.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The building GUARD sees Maya heading out to her car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good morning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good morning, Amad. Maya gets in her car. The gate opens. As she starts pulli out onto the street, suddenly a car drives up in front of her and THREE SHOOTERS come out and hammer Maya's Toyota.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - Bullets spider webbing the glass as Maya slams the car into reverse -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - Maya's guard starts returning fire, but his aim is terr - SHOOTERS bear down on Maya, pumping bullets into her ar car.
The gate closes, saving her, at the last possible moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maya shakes inside her vehicle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Any American in Pakistan is a target, they don't necessarily know I'm CIA.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doesn't matter. You're on a list. Next time there might not be bulletproof glass to save you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you, of all people, should know that once you are on their list, you never get off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll keep up on the surveillance, as best we can.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hakim paces on a street as the POTAHAR we've been followi drives past him. Hakim watches the vehicle enter a gated COMPOUND.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Langley Predator Bay is an impressive sight, a comman center bristling with high-tech equipment. The room is fi with TECHNICIANS. George is in the center, where he belon directing traffic. People come up and give him new pieces of information. The big screen displays a single image: The overhead satellite image of the compound in Abbottabo

dialogues.speaker: SUPERIMPOSE
dialogues.text: From the back of the room, Maya enters, and watches the activity unfold without her... without her input. George notices her, gives a thumbs up and then turns back his troops. STEVE, early 40s, a senior manager and one of George's to deputies, joins Maya.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Basically we had a guy who rolled with Al Qaeda and did services for them. We lost him for seven years and now we found him again -- and boy does he have a really nice house. Is that it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pretty much.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, let's go talk to the boss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maya and Steve are the first to arrive in the wood panell conference room. A detailed TABLE TOP MODEL of the compound sits in the ce of the conference table, right next to a poster-sized satellite image of the compound. She starts to sit in one of the chairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You should sit back there...sorry. Steve points her to the back of the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're gonna ask: if bin Laden is at the end of this rainbow - is the Pak military with him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The question isn't are the Paks protecting bin Laden?'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The question is, 'would he allow himself to be protected by the Paks?' I mean, why would he trust them? He tried to kill Musharaf. Steve considers a reply, but the meeting principals are f in, including Daniel, and when Steve sees the CIA DIRECTO enter the room, he clears the head of the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go ahead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you take a right out of Islamabad and drive about forty-five minutes North, you'll find yourself here in Abbottabad. A middle class community - some ex-military - not particularly interesting to us. Except we did find this compound, which is unique. We got a sixteen foot wall around the entire perimeter, the windows are blacked out. It's a fortress.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can't you put a camera somewhere - in the trees - to get a look into the main house?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It will probably be discovered.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have to get a look into the house. The Director moves to the satellite image.

dialogues.speaker: CIA DIRECTOR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Alright, what's this? This cluster of buildings down here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The PMA - The Pakistan Military Academy. It's their West Point.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And how close is that to the house?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: About a mile. A WOMAN'S voice from the back of the room.

dialogues.speaker: MAYA O.S.
dialogues.text: 4,221 feet. It's closer to eight- tenths of a mile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm the motherfucker that found this place, Sir. The boss studies her for a moment then turns back to the model.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to know more about who's inside this house by the end of the week. The brass files out, leaving Steve and Maya.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Motherfucker?" Really?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maya sits at her desk, frustrated, then walks down the ai of cubicles to the glass wall of George's office. She gra a red marker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (through the glass) Morning, George. In red magic marker, Maya writes the number 21 on the gla Then circles it. George looks up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Twenty-one days. It's been twenty- one days since we found the house and nothing's happened!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see a drone-fed overhead IMAGE of the bin Laden house real time with a resolution of 100 feet. Maya stares at t screen, trying to decipher the shapes moving beneath her, thousands of miles away.
The BLIPS move in increments, shadows lengthen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ECU - Maya erases the "51" on George's wall and replaces with "52." George looks away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maya sits at her desk. Her phone rings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STEVE stares at drone image of the COMPOUND, which is und the joystick control of an IMAGERY TECHNICIAN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Swing by, I want to show you something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maya jumps up from her desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maya walks in. Steve shows her images on the large monito

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is from a few minutes ago. We've got two males, two females, and seven kids. Maya points to one of the shapes in the courtyard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm saying that's Bushra. The brother's wife.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you know the gender?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (points on screen, to a thin line) This is a clothes-line here, for laundry. Men don't mess with the wash. We watch that shape move away from the clothes-line and b to the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It takes her about four seconds to move from there to the front door. So she's on the older side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that up there? (pointing to the other

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Those are kids. They're shuffling around, sword-fighting or something with sticks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can see their height relative to this - these are cows - so they're probably between seven and nine. Boys. Another FIGURE comes out of the house and moves to the cl line and grabs some laundry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your female is moving fast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what I wanted to show you. (to the Imagery

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can we pause this please?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not the same lady. That's female #3.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you found two males, three females?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's correct. Maya suddenly gets it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're missing a male.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes we are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: George is on one side of a conference table, on the other side is the DEPUTY NATIONAL SECURITY ADVISOR, THE SPECIAL ASSISTANT TO THE DEPUTY NATIONAL SECURITY ADVISOR, and th NATIONAL SECURITY ADVISOR.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If there are three females, there ought to be three males. Observant Muslim women either live with parents or with their husbands. We think there's a third family living in the house.

dialogues.speaker: NATIONAL SECURITY ADVISOR
dialogues.text: So this third male that you've identified as possibly being bin Laden, do I just give up all hope of ever seeing a photograph of him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hope? Hope is not a targeting layer. You give up your hope right now. We scanned for heat signatures, but we can't validate if it's a man or a woman up there. We found a safe house, but we can't get a vantage point to fire a telescope over the balcony wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A DOCTOR comes to the compound offering immunizations. On of the women let's him in, and he offers polio vaccines t the children.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We talked about burrowing a pin hole camera but there's a high risk of discovery.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have explored the possibility of digging tunnels, of sending hot air balloons, of re-routing supply C- 130's to take a peek, but that might be too alerting. We've looked for ways of collecting available DNA from his trash - you know, looking for his toothbrush, but they burn the trash. We started a vaccination program, we sent a doctor to the house, to see if he could pull blood. A lady in a black burkha rushes out and angrily shoos the doctor away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That didn't work out. We thought about sending a guy with a bucket to pull a sample from the sewer to analyze his fecal matter.

dialogues.speaker: SPECIAL ASSISTANT TO THE ADVISOR
dialogues.text: What was wrong with that, exactly? He looks up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What was wrong with that? The sample would be too diluted.

dialogues.speaker: NATIONAL SECURITY ADVISOR
dialogues.text: And it's asking too much to get a voice confirmation with him on the phone?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They don't make telephone calls from the compound. We pulled the cell tower nearby.

dialogues.speaker: NATIONAL SECURITY ADVISOR
dialogues.text: And I'm also going to give up hope that he might ever get in that white SUV and drive around a bit and we could see him? Don't they get groceries.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The unidentified third male does not get groceries. He does not leave the compound. He does not present himself for photographs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When he needs fresh air, he paces around beneath a grape arbor, but the leaves are so thick they obscure our satellite views. This is a professional attempt to avoid detection - real tradecraft. The only people we've seen behave this way are other top level Al Qaeda operatives. The National Security Advisor nods to his Special Assista who slides a big folder across his desk to George.

dialogues.speaker: NATIONAL SECURITY ADVISOR
dialogues.text: We did a Red Team on your analysis. According to them, this behavior could belong to someone other than Al Qaeda.

dialogues.speaker: DEPUTY NATIONAL SECURITY ADVISOR
dialogues.text: They did give a forty percent chance that the unidentified third man is a senior Al Qaeda operative. But they also said there's a thirty-five percent chance he's a Saudi drug

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (reading from the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A fifteen percent chance that he's a Kuwaiti arms smuggler, a ten percent chance that he's one of the relatives of the brothers.

dialogues.speaker: SPECIAL ASSISTANT TO THE ADVISOR
dialogues.text: Basically, we agree with you, the house screams security, it screams someone who wants privacy, it even screams 'bad guy', but it does not scream bin Laden.

dialogues.speaker: NATIONAL SECURITY ADVISOR
dialogues.text: You get the point.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you can't prove it's bin Laden, at least prove it's not somebody else, like a drug dealer. Beat. The meeting is adjourned. As they walk out --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know we lost our ability to prove that when we lost the detainee program.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who the hell am I supposed to ask? Some guy in Gitmo who is all lawyered up? He'll just tell his lawyer to warn bin Laden.

dialogues.speaker: NATIONAL SECURITY ADVISOR
dialogues.text: You'll think of something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maya is back at George's office, keeping track of time fo us by writing each passing day on the window of George's office. We watch as she erases the numbers in red and writes new ones. 78. Time passes. 98. 99. 100. 100 days. She underscores the numerals in thick magic mar

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The same group around the same conference table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He'd be the first successful drug dealer never to have dealt drugs. He has no internet access to the house. He makes no phone calls either in or out. Who's he selling to, who's he buying from, how's he making his money? And if you're going to say he's retired, I'd say where's his swimming pool, where's the gold cage with the falcons? And why does he send his courier to the two cities in Pakistan we most associate with Al Qaeda, that have nothing particularly to do with heroin production? The National Security Advisor taps his pencil impatiently

dialogues.speaker: NATIONAL SECURITY ADVISOR
dialogues.text: The President is a thoughtful, analytical guy. He needs proof.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The National Security Advisor and his team file out. Geor approaches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have to admit, I just don't get the rhythms of politics.

dialogues.speaker: NATIONAL SECURITY ADVISOR
dialogues.text: You think this is political? If this was political we'd be having this conversation in October when there's an election bump. This is pure risk. Based on deductive reasoning, inference, supposition and the only human reporting you have is six years old, from detainees who are questioned under duress. The political move here is to tell you to go fuck yourself, and remind you that I was in the room when your old boss pitched WMD Iraq...at least there you guys brought photographs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, you're right, I agree with everything you just said. What I meant was, a man in your position, how do you evaluate the risk of not doing something, the risk of potentially letting bin Laden slip through your fingers? George shakes his head with an "aww shucks" kind of shake

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That is a fascinating question. George walks away. After a beat, the National Security advisor calls after him.

dialogues.speaker: NATIONAL SECURITY ADVISOR
dialogues.text: Hey. George turns around. The National Security Advisor approa him.

dialogues.speaker: NATIONAL SECURITY ADVISOR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (lowering his voice) I'm not saying we're gonna do it. But the President wants to know: if we were going to act, how would we do it? Give us options.

dialogues.speaker: SUPERIMPOSE
dialogues.text: Doors of a HANGAR open in front of a large crowd that inc several White House guys, a General, and a squadron of Na SEALs, including PATRICK, JUSTIN, JARED, SABER, TWO SOAR PILOTS, and some members of the Af-Pak department, George Daniel, Hakim, and of course, Maya. The doors grind open reveal: TWO STEALTH BLACKHAWKS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I actually tried to kill this program a couple of times. They've gone through an initial round of testing, and they have excellent radar defeat - we just haven't tested them with people in them yet. The General continues his briefing..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll notice these stealth panels similar to what we use on the B2 - (pointing to the rotors) - The rotors have been muffled with decibel killers - it's slower than a Blackhawk and lacks the offense. But it can hide.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me. Can I ask a question? What do we need this for in Libya? Gaddafi's anti-air is virtually non- existent. Maya looks over, not sure what to say.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gentlemen, can I have your attention? My name is George. I run the Af-Pak division at CTC, and I'm primary on this for the agency. This is a title fifty operation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some of us have worked together before. This is a good one. Maya, do you want to brief them? Maya looks at the SEALs. Folds her arms. This isn't going to be easy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There are two narratives about the location of Osama bin Laden. This registers on the SEALs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The one that you're most familiar with is that UBL is hiding in a cave in the Tribal Areas, that he's surrounded by a large contingent of loyal fighters. Beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But that narrative is pre- 9/11 understanding of UBL. The second narrative is that he's living in a city - living in a city with multiple points of egress and entries and with access to communications so that he can keep in touch with the organization. You can't run a global network of inter- connected cells from a cave. Beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've located an individual we believe based on detainee reporting is bin Laden's courier. He's living in a house in Abbottabod, Pakistan. And we assess that one of the other occupants of the house is UBL.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me. You got an intel source on the ground?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No? Okay, so how do you know it's bin Laden? We've been on this op before, you know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bin Laden uses a courier to interact with the outside world. By locating the courier, we've located bin Laden.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's really the intel? That's it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quite frankly, I didn't even want to use you guys, with your dip and your velcro and all your gear bullshit. I wanted to drop a bomb but people didn't believe in this lead enough to drop a bomb, so they're using you guys as canaries on the theory that if bin Laden isn't there, you can sneak away and no one will be the wiser.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But bin Laden is there - and you're going to kill him for me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bullets are cheap.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: George is shaking his head as he talks to Wolf.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They are nervous downtown. I don't think we'll get approval this decision cycle. They look up and notice that Maya is standing outside Geo office staring at them through the glass. She angrily wipes the number 128 off the window and chang it to 129. Wolf nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's her against the world.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: George is pulling his tray away from the food service cou when Maya ambushes him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've spun up the SEALs - we've done everything humanly possible to collect on the compound, and the collection is not going to get any better.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have to keep working it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're going to come into work one day, and there's going to be a black moving van and a 'for sale' sign in front of that compound. George drops his tray down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maya, you didn't prove it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sitting around the table are the CIA Director, JEREMY, Wo the DEPUTY DIRECTOR, George, Daniel, Steve and a few othe people we don't know. At the far end of the table are bac benchers, including Maya.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm about to go look the President in the eye and what I'd like to know, no fucking bullshit, is where everyone stands on this thing. Now, very simply. Is he there or is he not fucking there? He looks to the Deputy Director.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We all come at this through the filter of our own past experiences. I remember Iraq WMD very clearly, I fronted that and I can tell you the case for that was much stronger than this case.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes or no.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We don't deal in certainty, we deal in probability. I'd say there's a sixty percent probability he's there. The CIA Director points to Wolf.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I concur. Sixty percent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm at eighty percent. Their OPSEC is what convinces me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You guys ever agree on anything?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I agree with sixty, we're basing this mostly on detainee reporting and I spent a bunch of time in those rooms - who knows? Maya shoots Daniel a look. What a traitor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd say it's a soft sixty, sir. I'm virtually certain there's some high value target there, I'm just not sure it's bin Laden. The CIA Director leans back in his chair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is a cluster-fuck, isn't it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd like to know what Maya thinks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're all incorporating her assessment into ours. Maya can't take it anymore:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One hundred percent, he's there - okay, fine, ninety-five percent because I know certainty freaks you guys out - but it's a hundred!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The CIA Director walks with Jeremy towards the elevator.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're all cowed. What do you think of the girl?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think she's fucking smart. As the door closes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're all smart, Jeremy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maya is eating lunch by herself when she's startled to se the CIA Director standing by her table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: May I join you? She nods, gulps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How long have you worked for the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Twelve years. I was recruited out of high school.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you know why we did that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think I can answer that question, sir. I don't think I'm allowed to answer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What else have you done for us besides bin Laden?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing. I've done nothing else. He evaluates her... weighing her certainty against his de of Washington experience.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, you certainly have a flare for it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jalalabad Airfield: nestled against the rugged mountains the Pakistan border.

dialogues.speaker: MAY 1, 2011
dialogues.text: Everything in motion, SOLDIERS, CONTRACTORS, AVIATION ASS PATROLS coming and going.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Patrick and Justin are playing horseshoes. Maya, happy fo the first time since we've met her, watches them

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, Patrick, be honest with me. You really believe this story?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No offense.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What part convinced you? Patrick motions to Maya.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her confidence. Maya smiles, laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really? Okay. That's the kind of concrete data point I'm looking for. He shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If her confidence is the one thing that's keeping me from getting ass- raped in a Pakistani prison...I don't know. I'm gonna be honest with you though, I guess I'm cool with it.
They bump fists, laughing. Maya's cell phone rings. She moves aside to answer it. We INTERCUT with George in his Langley office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maya, I wanted you to hear it first. You know that thing we talked about? It's going to happen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tonight. Good luck. She hangs up, turns back to the SEALs, who are still play horseshoes with the grace of young guys in their prime. Their lives are in her hands.

dialogues.speaker: BASE
dialogues.text: The small space is filled with personnel and telecommunications gear. At the back of the room Maya sit quietly, adjusting a headset and speaking calmly into a s line. From the corner Hakim watches her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Testing - testing 1 - 2 - 3 - A SEAL with his com set on gives her the thumbs up. She looks around at all the impressive technology in the make Command Center. She walks over to Hakim and they leave together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you for coming with me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course. I'll go with you where ever you want. A few hundred feet in front of them they can see SEALs preparing their gear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck Hakim, what if I'm wrong?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wish we could have just dropped a bomb.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please don't drop it while we're in the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm serious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me too. Don't drop anything while I'm inside. Off her anxious smile --

dialogues.speaker: LZ
dialogues.text: Blinding white lights - rigged to chain link fencing, lik space shuttle launch - Silhouetted shapes behind the lights and the thump-thump- thump SOUND of high-dollar helicopters - Now push through the glare and the fence into -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A top-secret LZ. Where twenty-two SEALs in full battle rattle and an attac DOG load into TWO STEALTH BLACKHAWK helicopters Moving fast, wordlessly, loading weapons and gear - under the intense bright white light, then - - Doors slam, engines whine - Fifty yards away, Maya stands alone, looking on. - And the HELOS rise above the lights and disappear into night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hands feather the controls as the pilot -- one the famed Nightstalker's from the Special Operations Aviation Regim (SOAR) 160th -- flies without lights, using only his NODs for night vision.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Flying in formation, barely visible in the moonless sky, flying lights. The helos near the Tora Bora mountain range: dimly visibl bulks rising in front of the helos.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The SEALs gently bounce inside the bellies of the churnin beasts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thirty seconds to first turn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey Justin, what are you listening to?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tony Robbins.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tony Robbins?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You should listen to it. I got plans for after this. I want to talk to you guys about it. It's not selling. You become a representative. Everyone chuckles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hard left.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The stealths take a sharp turn. Skimming the mountain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who here's been in a helo crash before? Everyone raises their hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, so we're all good.

dialogues.speaker: BASE
dialogues.text: Technicians track the helos on an array of computer scree

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now entering Pakistan. Maya is here, too, working. She's always working.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pakistani coms, no chatter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Find the HELICOPTERS navigating tight mountain passes. NO Throughout the flying sequence that follows the helicopte fly very close to the ground, with a margin of error less then twenty feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The terrain zooms by as we travel through a twisty mounta

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - Looming straight ahead on a collision course is a GIANT MOUNTAIN. They zoom closer. We can see individual rocks n

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Big left!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seconds before impact, the HELICOPTERS bank into a hard l turn. DUST blows off the mountain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The dog PANTS - sitting in its handler's lap in the dim c

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ten minutes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three mikes to target. Standby for doors open. Inside the dim interior, illuminated by only blinking instrumentation, the men are tense, quiet. We pass slowly from face to face, noting each SEAL's contemplation of the mission that lies ahead. Some of them are anonymous soldiers. Many we've come to know: Justin, joyfully bobbing his head, grooving to his iPod... Saber's eyes fixed on a thousand-yard stare... Ha struggles to get comfortable and control his anxiety, wip away sweat... Patrick checks his gear for the hundredth t

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two minutes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Outside: Darkness....just a THUMP THUMP THUMP... And then we see them: flying in tight formation, the oddl rectangular helos, with their black stealth panels and sh edges, like two alien spaceships advancing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Should be coming up just off our nose, 3 o'clock. Everyone grabs onto their gear, getting ready to fast rop

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Patrick flings open the side door. Night wind rushes in -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Small cottages mixed in with larger suburban homes. Among them, swimming pools. The water shimmering. Surreal. Then rows of green fields. A stand of trees. It appears: AC 1. It is massive - six or seven times larg than any other nearby structure - with sixteen foot high walls and a gated interior. A fortress.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thirty seconds. Patrick leans out for a visual as the wind rips his face

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The helos circle the COMPOUND, kicking up dust, and begin descend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cross cutting all that follows: - At thirty feet above the ground the helicopter begins t shudder and lose stability. Instead of descending in a straight path, the bird drifts sideways

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shouting to pilot) Hey! Slide right. - Then lurches down, falling to within 15 feet of the swi ground, rotors churning the dust, creating near BROWNOUT conditions, a dust hurricane

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CU: Pilot finessing the controls - not good enough

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Power!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ECU: rear rotor blades edging closer to the wall, inch by inch. -- Engines straining LOUDLY in the thin, hot air -- The bird loses control, SPINS to a hard landing

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ECU: Pilot thrusts stick

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- TAIL crashes hard on the WALL, in a awful screech of twisting metal and sheared concrete -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Tossing the men inside the helo around like rag dolls.

dialogues.speaker: BASE
dialogues.text: The command tent watches the helicopter crash.

dialogues.speaker: PRINCE 52 PILOT, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Prince 51 is down. Blackhawk down in the animal pen. Maya stands, crestfallen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The dust settles to reveal...a twisted wreck. PRINCE 51 has crash landed into a precarious position, wi the back half of the helicopter wedged into the top of th wall and the front of it in the ground, leaving the passe inside suspended more then ten feet off the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Although he's wearing a heavy pack and carrying gear, Pat jumps down, landing with a knee-shattering combat roll. Several SEALs follow him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Patrick pulls out of his roll and turns around to face th house, looming ominously ahead of him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This mission is still a go. Off Maya's relief -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The second helo passes over but a storm of debris and gar from the rooftop creates another flight risk and the helo banks away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Patrick, Justin and SIX other SEALs cluster near the Firs Gate in the animal pen. One of the SEALs places a charge the gate, while others check the Prayer Room. Boom! The charge partially blows open the metal swing doo of the gate, leaving a very narrow gap. Not ideal. The SEALs muscle and squeeze their way through the narrow ope in the jagged metal as the SNIPER climbs up on the roof o the prayer room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Patrick and Jared arrive at the guest house but can't see inside - the windows and doors are covered with sheets. Patrick kneels down to place a charge at the front door h when the door erupts with gunfire - Bullets fly out of the wooden door. One skims Patrick's shoulder as he kneels lower. Patrick fires back at the ho putting a dozen rounds inside. A moment passes. They wait for a response. The door handl unlocks. ABU AHMED'S WIFE appears at the doorway and walk out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ir-fah ee-dek!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You killed him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The SEALs peer inside and see ABU AHMED lying dead in a pool of blood. Patrick and Jared pump safety rounds into the body. FOUR KIDS are cowering in the corner. Jared moves them ou of the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The rest of the P51 SEALS breach a gate to the courtyard the Main House. The gate flies open in a fiery ball.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SEALs jump out of P52, rush to the outer wall and set breaching charges on a gate... While Hakim, the DOG HANDL and another SEAL peel off down the block Saber and his team stand by as BOOM!!!, The gate charges off...only to reveal a BRICK WALL behind the gate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not a door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Failed breach. They hustle to the next entry way and prepare another bre

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The COMMANDING OFFICER hears that the SEALs outside are preparing a charge. SEAL MIKE radios in

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is Echo 11, we're going to breach the main gate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Negative. I'm internal, I'll let you in. The Commanding Officer opens the gate and the other SEALs walk inside. As a group, they move towards the main house arriving at the South side front door. The door is open a they enter -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Piercing the first floor darkness with their infra red li the SEALs advance slowly into the first floor hallway. Piles of household clutter, stacked high in bizarre shape greet them like the innards of a haunted house. One of th SEAL's catches movement: A figure with an AK-47 scramblin through clutter, then disappearing around a corner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Abrar! The figure, Abu Ahmed's brother, ABRAR, re-appears at the end of the hallway. He pokes his head out -
- And is shot by Justin. He falls out of view, whimpering in pain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Justin walks quickly to Abrar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ABRAR is down, bleeding. - Justin fires another round into Abrar as ABRAR'S WIFE c flying in from the sleeping quarters and shields him with her body. - Justin shoots her. She falls...Abrar is underneath her he is still breathing, gasping and - Justin shoots him again, silencing him - Then looks to his wife and assesses her condition - Badly wounded, faint breathing, life fading from her ey - Justin turns away

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Justin and a BREACHER proceed down the hall to the heavy gate that blocks access to the stairway while another SEA stays behind. Somewhere, children are screaming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut those fucking kids up. O.S. the kids quiet down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Talk to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's no fucking way we want to blow this thing. The gate is solid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is Echo 11 - we're at our primary set point, prepping to breach.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait, Echo 11 - we're internal on the south side - this is a negative breach.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roger. We're ready to make our entry out here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roger that, we're coming to meet you. (to the Breacher) Stay with these kids. Don't let them in the back room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the regrouping that occurs on the side of the main hou Justin and Patrick find themselves side by side - and the old friends take a moment to reconnect while the rest of team places charges and prepares for the next phase of th assault.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You good?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. I forgot...were we supposed to crash that helo? Patrick allows himself a smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ibrahim tried to shoot me through the door. I popped him from the outside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I fucking smoked Abrar and his wife.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (alt: I think she was

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Still alive?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's gonna bleed out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What a fuckin' mess - The door blows - and they keep moving -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The SEALs reach the staircase, which is sealed off by a separate metal gate than the one inside the hallway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Breacher up. A charge is prepared. Justin, who is now inside one of th side rooms, sees Jared standing close to the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey man, move! Jared moves just as -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - Boooom! -- The door FLIES like a missile right into where Jared h been standing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Saber goes up the staircase, Patrick following closely be him, climbing up to see -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A man ducks out of sight. Saber calls to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Khaled! Saber waits with his carbine raised. Anxiety crosses his face. He's vulnerable here, an easy target if Khaled were to come out blasting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Khaled hears his name being called from below. A few feet away from him in the dimly lit hall is a loaded AK-47. He goes to the gun and picks it up. He hears his name again, "Khaled!" And the voice sounds friendly, urgent. Perhaps thinking that he can surrender peacefully, Khaled puts the gun down, resting it against a wall, and turns a heads back to the sound of his name. Saber sees Khaled poke his head around the corner of the stairway and fires - killing him instantly. Saber pushes past the body, Patrick following, and they c the staircase leading to the third floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The neighborhood, awakened by the crash and gunfire, stir to life. Hakim and the SEALs notice LIGHTS flipping on. And down the block, a group of several young men appear o roof.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (raising his weapon) This is Echo 05, I've got unknowns gathering on the Southwest Rooftops. Hakim, move those guys back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (speaking in Pashto) Go back brothers, this is official government business, and there is nothing to see here!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going to start wasting them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please! They will kill you! The onlookers pause. SEAL aiming lasers dance across thei chests.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They will kill you! They turn and go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - SEALs clear the SECOND floor as women and children flow into the hallway... A SEAL grabs one of the wives and pul her out into the hallway, while another female disappears behind a large REFRIGERATOR, and he grabs her too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Justin opens a file cabinet, stuffed with documents.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Saber is climbing the stairs, gun up, towards the third f when he sees a flash of movement across the landing above him. He stops climbing and -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Osama! Osama!? Beat. Beat. Sweat on Saber's face

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Osama!? A man appears at the end of the third floor hallway. -- Ssssht ! a bullet strikes him in the head - knocking h back into a bedroom - Saber fires again, missing - And proceeds down the hallway, going full speed now, Patrick right behind him, sprinting into the bedroom

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two women stand at the entrance of the room. Saber rushes them and with a football tackle, slams them into the wall Patrick enters the room and fires several rounds into the man on the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Possible jackpot. The women Saber is restraining are wailing, struggling to get to their husband, as a ten year-old boy rushes up to body.
Patrick pushes him away and kneels down to get a better l at the body.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dude, do you realize what you just did?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JARED questions the wives.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who is he?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He is al Noori Hasan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shouting back to

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She says it's not him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Talk to a kid. Jared kneels down next to a nine year-old girl huddled in the corner and snaps open a chem light. He gives her the glowing green wand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daughter, what is his name? The girl makes no reply.

dialogues.speaker: COMMANDING OFFICER, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: (through the radio) For God and Country, Geronimo. Maya gasps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Commanding Officer issues orders.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All Stations: target secure, target secure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roger. Copy. Target Secure.

dialogues.speaker: COMMANDING OFFICER, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Target Secure - commence SSE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Justin flicks on the lights. Moving fast he picks up a COMPUTER tower and throws it to the floor, cracking it op rips out the HARD DRIVE and tosses that into the bag. As we pull back and realize the enormity of the task in f of him - The lights show an organized office, crammed with informa stacks of files, disks, video equipment. Twenty years of jihad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to his team) Do not leave a hard drive. The SEALs gather everything they can.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Saber walks down the staircase in a daze. We stay with hi as he descends, noting the faraway look in his eyes -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Saber walks into the office where the SSE (Sensitive Sigh Exploitation) is underway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I shot the third floor guy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good for you. You want to help?
Justin tosses him an SSE bag.

dialogues.speaker: BASE
dialogues.text: The command team studies their monitors. PRINCE 52 PILOT O.S.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: QRF inbound.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The COMMANDING OFFICER is talking on two radios at once - one to his men, the other to brass back at Jalalabad base

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Echo 05, this is Red 02, how long do you need for SSE?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At least ten minutes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have four.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is a gold mine, I need more time than that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you're not at the LZ in four, I'm going to leave your ass behind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Justin yells to his team.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Four minutes!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hakim arrives at the crashed helo. He crawls into the interior and finds a BLACK BODY BAG. We follow this bag:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hakim jogs into the main house with the BODY BAG, and thr his POV, we see slow down for the first time since the ra began, noting the destruction: - blood stains on the walls, - Bodies pierced with bullets, - Wailing children.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where do you need the bag?

dialogues.speaker: SEAL, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Third floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SEALs roll the body into the BAG as Patrick and another S collect articles of interest. Two SEALs zip up the bag an carry it out. Just as...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Justin's team leaves the office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The body bag is laid in the courtyard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The EOD SEAL slides into the belly of Prince 51. While he places charges, another SEAL climbs up to affix charges t the roof and rotors ...and like a tight roper, he walks o on the tail of the helicopter, when suddenly his foot sli piercing the tail's thin skin, and he nearly falls off. He manages to place a last charge - but the remainder of tail piece will not be detonated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Back at the whirling helicopter, the SEALs shove the BODY BAG into the interior compartment and jump in after it. The helo rises into the night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PRINCE 51 explodes, sending shrapnel and a fireball high into the air

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The SEALs watch the flames as the compound shrinks beneat

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The fire of the exploded crashed helo blazes in the night

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The SEALs sit silent in the cabin, body bag at their feet

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bathed in the bright white lights, Maya waits for the hel Concern on her face. At last, she hears it. A moment later, PRINCE 52 hovers into view and lands. Pat and several SEALs run out, carrying the bag...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The place is swarming with SOLDIERS, SEALs, and FBI agent with large bio-metric scanners - loud shouting everywhere "mark media, first floor, who has a pen, etc."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maya makes her way towards the hangar tent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She pushes through the busy SEALs. Maya sees it now - way in the corner of the hangar.

She walks and walks towards the bag. She is alone with it now. She unzips the BAG CU: Maya. Seven years telescoping to this moment. The end of a jour She stares at the body for a moment then turns to look ac the room where ADMIRAL MCRAVEN meets her eye. She nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir, the agency expert gave a visual confirmation. Yes, Sir, the girl. Hundred percent. Maya gazes at the bloodied face, then turns away and zips the bag...and leaves the tent. Her eyes afire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maya waits on the tarmac, alone. A C-17, one of the largest most impressive planes in the American fleet, rolls to a stop and the hatch opens. She climbs the ladder -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cavernous cargo plane is empty of passengers. The pil motions to the seats.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you Maya?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's the only name they gave me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can sit wherever you want, you're the only one on the manifest.
Maya sits down, buckles in. The PILOT heads back to the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You must be pretty important, you got the whole plane to yourself! Beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where do you want to go? She's speechless. Overwhelmed. Finally, she lets go. Those luminous eyes become pools of relief and pain.
